channel.title: How-To Geek
channel.description: We explain technology. Learn more with our articles, reviews, tips, and the best answers to your most pressing tech questions.

item.title: Why Brave Convinced Me to Finally Stop Using Chrome
item.dc:creator: Aran Folsom
item.description: Change can be scary. It's time to be Brave.
item.content:encoded: I've been a loyal fan of Google since Chrome's lightning-fast speed and minimalist design saved us from Internet Explorer in 2008. With the release of Gmail, Google Docs, and the rest of the apps that make up what is now Google Workspace, Google began managing every aspect of my online life.

item.title: Why You Shouldn’t Use a Full Path in Your Linux Aliases
item.dc:creator: Bobby Jack
item.description: Keep your aliases short and sweet.
item.content:encoded: Sometimes, you may see advice that suggests using full paths in your aliases. Stop a moment. Is that really the behavior you want, and how can you even decide?

item.title: 5 Weird Products That Run on Power Tool Batteries
item.dc:creator: Cory Gunther
item.description: Did you know power tool brands make these wild products?
item.content:encoded: Being equipped with the proper tools can make any DIY job or construction project easier and more effective, but sometimes the tool you need is one you never knew existed. Many of you have a cordless drill, sawzall, and other random tools, but did you know your favorite brand also makes things like a battery-powered Tig welder or coffee machine for a fresh cup on the job site?

item.title: I Used a 10-Year-Old Smartwatch for a Week (and I Still Love It)
item.dc:creator: Joe Fedewa
item.description: It’s hard to beat a classic.
item.content:encoded: Smartwatches have gotten incredibly, well, smart over the years. They have digital assistants, speakers, virtual keyboards, and the ability to run full apps. Is all that really necessary, though? I used a 10-year-old smartwatch to find out.

item.title: I Grew Up on These Disney Afternoon Cartoons—And I Bet You Did Too
item.dc:creator: Mark McPherson
item.description: If you want to relive the early 1990s, there’s no better way than turning on these Disney Afternoon classics.
item.content:encoded: Before Kids WB and Fox Kids were the must-watch blocks of network television, there was The Disney Afternoon. The syndicated block of Disney-produced cartoon shows was special because it didn’t look or feel like most afternoon cartoons of the early 1990s. They had better animation quality, catchy theme songs, and an adventurous spirit.

item.title: This Self-Hosted File Converter Solved My WebP Woes
item.dc:creator: Jordan Gloor
item.description: You can use this same tool to convert PDF, MP4, and many other types of files.
item.content:encoded: The internet has taught me I can be sure of three things: death, taxes, and file upload fields that won't accept WebP images. I'm not aware of any self-hostable solutions to the first two problems, but the latter I was able to solve by running an open source service called ConvertX on my Raspberry Pi.

item.title: One UI 8 is Official, Better Scam Detection, and Resizable Quick Settings: Android This Week
item.dc:creator: Joe Fedewa
item.description: Android news, editorials, and more from the last 7 days.
item.content:encoded: It was another solid week for Android users. The latest Android 16 beta is out with some fun visual goodies for Pixel owners, and we've got the latest on the new Nothing OS update, which includes an "Extra dark mode." Plus, the first software update for the new Pixel 10 series, and which devices will (and won't) be getting Android 16.

item.title: My Surround Sound System Is 15 Years Old and I Still Wouldn't Replace It
item.dc:creator: Adam Davidson
item.description: If it ain't broke, don't replace it.
item.content:encoded: Technological developments move at a fast pace, so it's not uncommon to find that even relatively new devices can soon become obsolete. That's why it's always refreshing when products you bought a long time ago still continue to fulfill their purpose. My current surround sound system was purchased 15 years ago, and despite its age, I don't see any reason to replace it yet.

item.title: Where Every EV Automaker in America Stands Heading Into 2026
item.dc:creator: Tyler Dupont
item.description: A look at how every American EV maker is positioned for 2026 as demand, production, and policy changes reshape the market.
item.content:encoded: Electric vehicles are entering a pivotal phase as 2026 approaches. Established brands and ambitious startups alike are racing to expand lineups, refine battery technology, and meet tightening regulations, but their progress varies widely. Some automakers are rolling out record numbers of new EVs, while others are scaling back plans or delaying key launches amid shifting consumer demand and rising costs.

item.title: 8 Games You Can Play in Your Ubuntu Terminal
item.dc:creator: Ali Haider
item.description: Turn your Linux terminal from a serious productivity tool to a playground filled with challenges and excitement
item.content:encoded: Many of us fear the Linux terminal and might even hesitate to open it. Why is that? Probably because it’s all text, endless commands, and not a single graphical button in sight. It gives off the vibe of a serious, no-nonsense boss. Strictly business and no fun allowed.
